intro: Astragalus camptoceras, commonly known as the bent-stem milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is characterized by its slender, often zigzagging stems and small, yellowish to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces pods that contain several small, kidney-shaped seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and grassland habitats. Astragalus camptoceras is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and has the ability to fix nitrogen through its root nodules.
